p: When adequate data are available, many methods, such as the Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Tangent Distance Classifiers (TDCs), can achieve good accuracy in automatic classification[ 42]. In a report by LeCun et al. on handwritten character recognition, more than 60,000 handwritten characters were used, resulting in a significantly reduced error rate[ 42]. Additionally, the ImageNet Large-Scale Visual Recognition Challenge (ILSVRC) uses approximately 1.2 million images for training, 50,000 for validation, and 150,000 images for testing[ 39].
